amendment.description: Amendment requires the Secretary of Education, in consultation with the Commissioner of Internal Revenue, to conduct a study on the feasibility and advantages and disadvantages of using individual income tax returns as the primary form of application for student aid.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 11 printed in Part A of House Report 113-546 to require the Secretary of Education, in consultation with the Commissioner of Internal Revenue, to conduct a study on the feasibility and advantages and disadvantages of using individual income tax returns as the primary form of application for student aid.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Grayson amendment (A011) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Grayson amendment (A011) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A011) offered by Mr. Grayson.
